channel.title: Top Videos
channel.description: Play live videos and find up-to-date market news. View Top Videos, Most Viewed, US, Europe, Asia, Analyst Interviews, and CEO Interviews.

item.title: Tame inflation and stronger real growth are good signs for stock market: WisdomTree's Jeremy Siegel
item.description: Jeremy Siegel, Wharton professor emeritus and WisdomTree senior economist, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss the latest PCE report, if the Fed should deemphasize inflation and much more.

item.title: Former CEA chair: Protecting Fed independence is critical for U.S. and global economy
item.description: Jared Bernstein, former CEA chair, joins CNBC's 'Money Movers' to discuss the brief submitted by former top U.S. economic officials in support of Fed governor Lisa Cook and what the risks of Federal Reserve independence could mean for the economy.

item.title: BMO Capital Markets increases year-end S&P 500 target to 7,000
item.description: Brian Belski, chief investment strategist at BMO Capital Markets, joins 'Halftime Report' to explain why his firm is raising its S&P price target to 7,000.

item.title: President Trump announces new tariffs: Here's what you need to know
item.description: The Investment Committee debates what the new tariffs announced by Trump means for the market and your money. We have full team coverage with CNBC's Eamon Javers and Emily Wilkins with the latest.

item.title: Mark Zandi: From a market perspective, government shutdown is 'no big deal'
item.description: Moody's Mark Zandi joins CNBC's 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss the potential impact to markets and macro from a government shutdown.

item.title: Solus' Dan Greenhaus: Government shutdown 'doesn't matter at all' for markets
item.description: Dan Greenhaus, Solus Alternative Asset Management chief strategist and managing director, joins CNBC's 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss market outlooks.

item.title: Are AI investors in for a rude awakening? Elevation Partners' Roger McNamee weighs in
item.description: Roger McNamee, Elevation Partners co-founder, joins CNBC's 'Money Movers' to discuss his concerns around AI, what investors need to know, and much more.

item.title: DWS Group's David Bianco: Stay with tech, but pick the winners & look elsewhere
item.description: David Bianco, DWS Group Americas CIO, joins CNBC's 'Money Movers' to discuss whether he buys into the broadening trend, sectors he's keeping an eye on, and more.

item.title: Core inflation rate held at 2.9% in August, as expected, Fed’s gauge shows
item.description: CNBC's Rick Santelli joins 'Squawk Box' to break down the August PCE inflation data.

item.title: 'How to save the internet': Sir Nick Clegg on the intersection of politics and tech
item.description: Nick Clegg, former UK deputy prime minister, former Meta global affairs president and ‘How to Save the Internet’ author, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss the fragmentation of the internet, the biggest risks facing the internet, future of TikTok in the U.S., and more.

item.title: The economy continues to have a tremendous amount of momentum, says Morgan Stanley's Daniel Skelly
item.description: Daniel Skelly, Morgan Stanley Wealth Management managing director, joins 'Squawk Box' to discuss the latest market trends, state of the economy, how long the current bull market can last, why he likes the healthcare sector, and more.

item.title: President Trump signs TikTok deal: Here's what to know
item.description: CNBC's Eamon Javers and Eunice Yoon join 'Squawk Box' to break down President Trump's executive order to keep TikTok running in the United States.

item.title: A top VC's guide to the hottest Asian markets for tech right now
item.description: Silicon Valley once dismissed Asia’s tech scene as a land of copycats. Today, those same hubs are driving real innovation—and global investors are taking notice. One of them is B Capital, a venture capital firm managing over $9 billion across nine offices in the U.S. and Asia. In this episode, B Capital co-founder and co-CEO Raj Ganguly joins "Beyond the Valley" from Singapore to share which Asian markets excite them most and the three ways AI is reshaping the startup landscape.

item.title: Not yet time to get worried about AI spend, says Trivariate's Adam Parker
item.description: Adam Parker, Trivariate Research, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss where he sees the market heading from here, what hinges on the AI trade and much more.

item.title: Tom Lee: There will be an AI 'shakeout' but valuations are still reasonable compared to late 90s
item.description: Tom Lee, Fundstrat head of research, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss the market's current standing, if the market's making too many bets on what might happen in the future and much more.

item.title: Market is pricing in the most optimistic scenario for Oracle: Rothschild and Redburn's Alex Haissl
item.description: Alex Haissl, Rothschild and Redburn analyst, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss why Oracle's AI-driven rally is over, what the market is pricing into Oracle's stock and much more.

item.title: U.S. 10-year Treasury approaches key level
item.description: CNBC's Rick Santelli reports on the latest news regarding the bond market.

item.title: Bespoke's Paul Hickey: Markets have gotten very extended in the short-term
item.description: Joe Moglia, FG Nexus co-founder and executive advisor, and Paul Hickey, Bespoke Investment Group co-founder, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss if the current market is similar to the late 90s, the technical indicators and much more.

item.title: Databricks CEO on OpenAI partnership: Enterprises are excited to get AI agents working
item.description: Ali Ghodsi, Databricks CEO, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss what enterprises are looking for with AI, how you can measure returns on the investments in AI and much more.

item.title: Sources: Oracle, Silver Lake, MGX to be main investors in TikTok U.S. with combined 45% ownership
item.description: CNBC's David Faber reports on the latest news regarding TikTok.

item.title: TikTok deal must feel like nothing has changed for users, says MNTN CEO Mark Douglas
item.description: Mark Douglas, MNTN CEO, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss a potential concern for advertisers, if advertisers are starting to go elsewhere and much more.

item.title: How vulnerable are stocks?
item.description: The Investment Committee debate how vulnerable the rally is as many big names are down again today.

item.title: Success Academy CEO: We don't think schools should be avenues for indoctrination
item.description: Ken Griffin, founder and CEO of Citadel, and Eva Moskowitz, founder and CEO of Success Academy, join CNBC's Sara Eisen to discuss the Academy's expansion into Florida, education reform in the state, and much more.

item.title: Ken Griffin on AI: 'There's obviously echoes of the dotcom bubble in this moment'
item.description: Ken Griffin, founder and CEO of Citadel, sits down with CNBC's Sara Eisen to discuss market outlooks, macro expectations, and much more.

item.title: Tusk Ventures CEO on AI spend: If there’s a paying product people want, that’s a good investment
item.description: Bradley Tusk, founder & CEO of Tusk Ventures, joins CNBC's 'Money Movers' to discuss mega cap tech's massive AI infrastructure spending and why he questions the use of “circular economy” to describe the sector.

item.title: White House says Lisa Cook has yet to correct the record as to the allegations of mortgage fraud
item.description: CNBC's Eamon Javers joins 'Money Movers' with the latest news.

item.title: Amazon reaches $2.5B settlement with FTC over 'deceptive' prime program
item.description: CNBC's MacKenzie Sigalos joins 'Money Movers' with the latest news.

item.title: Ken Griffin: If I were the president, I would let the Fed do their job
item.description: Ken Griffin, founder and CEO of Citadel, sits down with CNBC's Sara Eisen to discuss market outlooks, macro expectations, and much more.

item.title: Ken Griffin: We predict inflation will be in the mid 2 to 3% range next year
item.description: Ken Griffin, founder and CEO of Citadel, sits down with CNBC's Sara Eisen to discuss market outlooks, macro expectations, and much more.

item.title: Ken Griffin: Immigration policy is 'absolutely' playing out in labor market
item.description: Ken Griffin, founder and CEO of Citadel, sits down with CNBC's Sara Eisen to discuss market outlooks, how immigration policy is impacting job growth, and much more.
